net.bubbaland.megaciv.game

Class Civilization

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.bubbaland.megaciv.game.Civilization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Civilization>

    public class Civilization
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Civilization>
    Class for specifying the data object for a single civilization.
    Author:
    Walter Kolczynski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Civilization.Age
      Enumeration of ages along the AST track.
      static class  Civilization.AstChange
      Enumeration of possible results for an AST change.
      private static class  Civilization.AstPositionComparator
      A comparator for comparing two civilizations by AST position.
      static class  Civilization.AstRequirements
      A data object for holding AST requirements for a given Age.
      (package private) static class  Civilization.AstTableData
      A data object to hold all of the static data from the AST table for this civilization.

      A comparator for comparing two civilizations by census.
      private static class  Civilization.CityComparator
      A comparator for comparing two civilizations by number of cities.
      private static class  Civilization.MovementComparator
      A comparator for comparing two civilizations by which moves first.
      static class  Civilization.Name
      The names of the 18 allowed civilizations.
      static class  Civilization.Region
      Enumeration of possible regions.
      static class  Civilization.SortDirection
      Enumeration of directions for sorting a list of civilizations.

      Enumeration of allowed ways to sort a list of civilizations.

      static class  Civilization.totalTechCostComparator 
      private static class  Civilization.VpComparator
      A comparator for comparing two civilizations by number of victory points.

      • name

        private Civilization.Name name
        The civilization name

      • player

        private java.lang.String player
        The name of the player controlling this civilization.

      • astPosition

        private int astPosition
        The AST Position of the civilization (number of spaces advanced).

      • population

        private int population
        The population of this civilization.

      • nCities

        private int nCities
        The number of cities this civilization controls.

      • techs

        private java.util.HashMap<Technology,java.lang.Integer> techs
        A list of the advances the civilization has purchased.

      • typeCredits

        private final java.util.HashMap<Technology,java.util.ArrayList<Technology.Type>> typeCredits
        Some advances (Monument and Written Record) provide additional credits that are chosen by the player. This HashMap tracks the additional credits chosen. In order to allow correction of incorrect choices, the source advance is tracked as the key in the HashMap, with the list of credits the associated value.

      • smallGameCredits

        private java.util.HashMap<Technology.Type,java.lang.Integer> smallGameCredits

      • difficulty

        private Game.Difficulty difficulty
        The current difficulty of the game. This property really belongs to the Game, but Civilization needs it to properly calculate AST requirements. Whenever the difficulty is changed in Game, Game updates the difficulty for each Civilization.

      • hasPurchased

        private boolean hasPurchased
        A boolean for tracking whether this civilization has purchased advances yet this turn.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Civilization

        public Civilization(Civilization.Name name,
                    Game.Difficulty difficulty)
        The primary constructor for creating a civilization. Values are initialized to their start-of-game values.
        Parameters:
        name - The civilization name.
        difficulty - The current difficulty of the game.

      • Civilization

        private Civilization(Civilization.Name name,
                     java.lang.String player,
                     int population,
                     int nCities,
                     java.util.HashMap<Technology,java.lang.Integer> techs,
                     java.util.HashMap<Technology.Type,java.lang.Integer> scenarioCredits,
                     java.util.HashMap<Technology,java.util.ArrayList<Technology.Type>> typeCredits,
                     int astPosition,
                     Game.Difficulty difficulty,
                     boolean hasPurchased)
        An internal constructor that specifies all fields. This constructor is used to recreate the object from the JSON, as well as in the clone method.
        Parameters:
        name - The civilization name.
        player - The player controlling the civilization.
        population - The current population.
        nCities - The current number of cities.
        techs - A list of advances discovered by the civilization.
        typeCredits - A list of additional credits.
        astPosition - Current AST position of this civilization.
        difficulty - Current game difficulty.
        hasPurchased - Has the civilization purchased advances in the current round?

                                                             Civilization.SortDirection direction)
        Sort a list of civilizations based on the number of cities. Ties are broken based on AST rank. This sort is used for handing out trade cards.

        Returns:
        A sorted list of civilizations.

      • getOptimalTechsWorthNVp

        private java.util.List<Technology> getOptimalTechsWorthNVp(int vp,
                                                           java.util.ArrayList<Technology> availableTechs)
        Get the lowest cost list of techs that are worth a given number of VP total
        Parameters:
        vp - Number of total VP for the techs
        availableTechs - Techs available to purchase
        Returns:
        Lowest cost list of techs that are worth vp

      • getOptimalTechs

        public java.util.List<Technology> getOptimalTechs(int budget)
        Returns the optimal tech purchase, in terms of maximizing VP, for a given budget. Note: While the return will always have the lowest cost for the max VP possible, purchases including Anatomy (and less often Library) may be sub-optimal in the sense that the "free" tier-one technology taken may not be the most expensive available.
        Parameters:
        budget - Amount of money available to spend
        Returns:
        List of technologies worth the most VP at the lowest cost

      • getOptimalTechByCombinations

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Technology> getOptimalTechByCombinations(java.util.List<Technology> l1Techs,
                                                                            java.util.List<Technology> l2Techs,
                                                                            java.util.List<Technology> l3Techs,
                                                                            int nL1,
                                                                            int nL2,
                                                                            int nL3)
        Returns the minimum cost technology list for all possible combinations of list provided
        Parameters:
        l1Techs - List of tier-one technologies
        l2Techs - List of tier-two technologies
        l3Techs - List of tier-three technologies
        nL1 - Number of tier-one technologies to use
        nL2 - Number of tier-two technologies to use
        nL3 - Number of tier-three technologies to use
        Returns:
        Lowest-cost combination of technologies

      • Combinations

        private static <E> java.util.stream.Stream<java.util.List<E>> Combinations(java.util.List<E> l,
                                                                           int size)
        Copied from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28515516/enumeration-combinations-of-k-elements-using-java-8
        Parameters:
        l -
